From now on, we will only need modify the version in the root Cargo.toml.

candidates.title: feat(ic-certification): add ic-certification crate and move HashTree and Certificate types
candidates.body:
# Description

I'm working on the `response-verification` package (https://github.com/dfinity/response-verification) which will implement v2 of verification and certification for ICX Proxy and the Service Worker. The main crate is written in Rust and it will be compiled to WASM so it can be used in JS from the Service Worker. Because it will run in a browser WASM runtime we need to careful with the file size and also need to be weary of dependencies that are not compatible with this runtime. Moving these types into a separate crate allows us to share these types without pulling in the dependency tree of `ic-agent`.

Original PR: https://github.com/dfinity/ic-types/pull/26 
Related Slack conversation: https://dfinity.slack.com/archives/CGA566TPV/p1668615765842289

# Checklist:

- [x] The title of this PR complies with [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/).
- [x] I have edited the CHANGELOG accordingly.
- [x] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation.

candidates.title: feat: Replace garcon with backoff
candidates.body:
Implements SDK-824.

This additionally removes garcon from the public API; the backoff numbers dfx uses are good enough for anyone, and users who want a shorter timeout can use tokio's timeout function.

candidates.title: chore: bump candid version and prepare a release
fix: Remove use of the miracl_core_bls12381 crate
candidates.body:
# Description

The `miracl_core_bls12381` crate was created for use in the IC however it has a number of performance and security issues which have caused us to remove all uses of it within the IC itself. Speaking on behalf of the DFINITY crypto team which up until now has maintained this crate, we would at this point much rather yank all versions and forget it ever existed.

This replaces the code that used `miracl_core_bls12381` with instead using a small crate that uses the `zkcrypto/bls12_381` library.

Fixes # (issue)

# How Has This Been Tested?

Just with `cargo test`. Not sure if there is anything else that is required/useful if so let me know.

# Checklist:

- [x] The title of this PR complies with [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/).
- [x] I have edited the CHANGELOG accordingly.
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation. (N/A)

candidates.title: fix: lookup request status
candidates.body:
This PR fixes the method `lookup_request_status` to handle proofs of absence introduced in this [MR](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/7661).

The case
```
LookupResult::Unknown => Err(LookupPathUnknown(path_status.into())),
```
will be updated in the function `lookup_request_status` after this [MR](https://gitlab.com/dfinity-lab/public/ic/-/merge_requests/7661) is merged.

candidates.title: feat: `HyperReplicaV2Transport`
candidates.body:
# Description

`icx-proxy` already has to use `hyper`, and so not having to use `reqwest` would simplify things (also it has no need for `PasswordManager`). `HyperReplicaV2Transport` meets this need generically and ergonomically for any `hyper::Service` (with the correct bounds).

This change also technically moves `ReqwestHttpReplicaV2Transport` to it's own module, but everything is re-exported for backwards compatibility.

Also some minor style fixes and refactors:

- `PasswordManager::get` simplifies usage
- Remove `default-features` from `ic-utils`'s import of `ic-agent` (lets `icx-proxy` completely remove `reqwest` from dependency tree)
- Remove superfluous `Principal::to_text` call in formatting code (`to_text` just calls `Display` anyway)

# How Has This Been Tested?

Manually tested with dfinity/icx-proxy#45

# Checklist:

- [x] The title of this PR complies with [Conventional Commits](https://www.conventionalcommits.org/en/v1.0.0/).
- [x] I have edited the CHANGELOG accordingly.
- [x] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation.

candidates.title: chore: release agent-rs 0.16.0
candidates.body: Also, we missed some changelog entries along the way.

candidates.title: fix: raise minimum reqwest version to avoid TLS backend error
candidates.body:
If consumers of ic-agent didn't update their reqwest dependency manually, agent construction would fail with this error:

```
Could not create HTTP client.: reqwest::Error { kind: Builder, 
  source: "Unknown TLS backend passed to use_preconfigured_tls" } 
```
Update the dependency requirement to be at least reqwest >= 0.11.7.

candidates.title: fix: Fix clap deprecation
candidates.body: Fixes the new `clap` warning and updates `flate2`.

candidates.title: chore: update dependencies reported by cargo outdated -R
feat: revamp 128-bit wallet interface
candidates.body: Per discussion elsewhere, using 128-bit by default causes other problems, and #330 opens us up to storing the version. So this makes 128-bit functions as specific as the 64-bit ones, and the non-annotated functions instead select the correct version based on the version string, which it fetches when the interface object is initialized.

candidates.title: chore: Update Rust to 1.58.1
candidates.body: This PR updates the rust-toolchain.toml version to 1.58.1, enables 2021 edition for all the packages, and adds the new MSRV key to Cargo.toml.

candidates.title: feat: Add `HttpRequestStreamingCallbackAny` and change abstractions
candidates.body:
The added `HttpRequestStreamingCallbackAny` can be deserialize any function regardless of parameters and qualifiers. This is less safe and sane, but it's the only way to keep backwards compatibility with the current hack.

The new `_custom` variants of the various request functions enable use of these different callback and token varieties.

Also while we're breaking stuff, get rid of all the string copies everywhere.

- [x] Blocked on dfinity/candid#325
- [x] Blocked on dfinity/candid#327
- [x] Release of `candid 0.7.14`

candidates.title: chore: release rust agent 0.13.0
candidates.body: There were breaking changes since 0.12.1

candidates.title: feat: Re-genericize tokens
candidates.body:
re: dfinity/agent-rs#221 dfinity/agent-rs#203

Turns out you can actually get around candid's limitation on `IDLValue`. It just takes some careful rejiggering.

First, use `Reserved` to match anything. This seems like a valid use of `Reserved`, and should basically always be supported.

Second, use `deserialize_ignored_any` to actually get all the content with our own visitor (really just a copy of `IDLValueVisitor`). This is a little bit of a hack, but it works.

candidates.title: chore: Update Rust to 1.55.0 and clap to 3.0.0-beta.5
chore: update cargo dependencies
candidates.body:
Update crate dependencies reported by `cargo outdated -R`, with the exception of clap, which remains pinned at **3.0.0-beta.2**

This fixes an issue seen by users of the crate that updated to reqwest 0.11.7, where connections would fail with the following error:
```
Could not create HTTP client.: reqwest::Error { kind: Builder, source: "Unknown TLS backend passed to `use_preconfigured_tls`" }
```

This also fixes https://dfinity.atlassian.net/browse/SDK-115 by removing the direct dependency on webpki-roots altogether.
